description: A unique name for your deployment. Note that Kubernetes resources can't contain capital letters or special characters. Enter a name that uses only lowercase letters, numbers, hyphens or periods.
name: ocs-cluster-name

description: The total amount of storage available to the monitoring daemonset. The default size is '20Gi'.
name: mon-size

description: The storage class to use when dynamically provisioning devices for the monitor pods.
name: mon-storage-class

description: The amount of storage available to applications in your cluster. The total storage available to your applications is equal to the OSD size multiplied by the number of OSDs. The default value is '100Gi'.
name: osd-size

description: The storage class to use when dynamically provisioning devices for the monitor pods.
name: osd-storage-class

description: The number storage of daemonsets that you want to deploy. Each daemonset consists of 3 pods that each mount one disk equal to the osd-size that you specify. For example if you specify 'num-of-osd=2', 2 daemonsets are deployed that each contain 3 pods with one disk per pod for a total of 6 pods and 6 disks. App data is replicated across each daemonset. The default value is '1'.
name: num-of-osd

description: The IP addresses the worker nodes where you want to deploy ODF. The minimum number of worker nodes is 3.
name: worker-nodes

description: Set to 'true' if you want to upgrade the ODF version.
name: odf-upgrade

description: The billing type for your ODF configuration.
name: billing-type

description: The IBM COS regional public endpoint.
name: ibm-cos-endpoint

description: The location constraint that you want to use when creating your bucket. For example `us-east-standard`.
name: ibm-cos-location

description: The IBM COS access key ID (HMAC keys).
name: ibm-cos-access-key

description: The IBM COS secret access key (HMAC keys).
name: ibm-cos-secret-key

description: Enter 'true' or 'false' to enable or disable cluster-wide encryption.
name: cluster-encryption

description: The IAM API key that you want to use in your storage secrets.
name: iam-api-key
